name: Korean Meat Balls
author: Karen
instructions: Combine ground beef with soy sauce, oil, sugar, scallions, garlic, and margarine. Mix well. Roll the meat mixture into balls 3/4 inch in diameter. Place water chestnut inside meatball. Coat with flour, then dip into beaten eggs. Fry in hot well-greased skillet, turn over and cook until done. Drain on absorbent paper, serve hot.To prepare ahead, cook meat balls in the morning. Place in cov- ered dish and refrigerate. Reheat by spreading meat balls on baking sheet and place in preheated oven at 300Â° for 5 minutes.
